corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection consists of materials documenting the functions and activities of the C.C. Gately Company, a Brooklyn contracting firm operated by Joseph T. Gately in the late 19th century. Materials include ledgers, cash books, and other financial records, including receipts and cancelled checks.

p.value: Identification of item, date; C.C. Gately Company Records; AIA 039; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Dermot Gately in March of 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.030.
The C.C. Gately Company (1856-1905) was a contracting firm operated by Joseph T. Gately in Brooklyn, New York.

This collection consists of materials documenting the functions and activities of the C.C. Gately Company, a Brooklyn contracting firm operating in the late 19th century. Materials include ledgers, cash books, and other financial records, including receipts and cancelled checks.

subject.value: Construction industry |z New York (State) |z New York.
Irish Americans |z New York (State) |z New York.
